Description: Unique identifier for each synthetic patient.
Patient's age (in years) at the time of ALS diagnosis.
Patient's body weight (in kilograms) at diagnosis.
Data Type / Range / Notes: Float (1 decimal place). Generated from N(75,122).

Description: Initial location of symptom onset (Spinal vs. Bulbar).
Data Type / Range / Notes: Categorical (String: 'Spinal', 'Bulbar'). Bulbar is often associated with a worse prognosis.

Description: Time (in months) from symptom onset to diagnosis.
Data Type / Range / Notes: Integer, typically 3-20 months. Generated from N(12,42).

Description: Baseline score on the ALS Functional Rating Scale-Revised.
Data Type / Range / Notes: Integer (Range: 0-48). Lower score indicates worse functional ability.

Description: Baseline Forced Vital Capacity (a measure of lung function) as a percentage of predicted.
Data Type / Range / Notes: Float (1 decimal place). Range: 40-120%. A key prognostic factor.

Description: Indicates if the patient is receiving Riluzole treatment.
Presence of the common C9orf72 genetic mutation.
Presence of associated cognitive or behavioral impairment (e.g., ALSci, FTD).
Indicates a family history of ALS.
Data Type / Range / Notes: Integer (Binary: 1 = Positive, 0 = Negative). Most cases are sporadic.

Description: Predominant motor neuron involvement at onset.

Data Type / Range / Notes: Float (1 decimal place). Marker of muscle mass/decline. Generated from N(80,152).

Description: The total time (in months) the patient survived after diagnosis.
Data Type / Range / Notes: Integer. Skewed distribution (Gamma, shape=2, scale=18) with a mean target of 36 months.
